thread.title: Taiwan Plunged into Darkness: Typhoon Kang Rui Leaves 89,000 Households Without Power
thread.title_full: Taiwan Plunged into Darkness: Typhoon Kang Rui Leaves 89,000 Households Without Power

author: newsdirectory3
title: Taiwan Plunged into Darkness: Typhoon Kang Rui Leaves 89,000 Households Without Power
text:
2024/11/1 15:13 (Updated at 11/1 16:53)
typhoon brought strong winds and heavy rain and hit Taitung, causing many power outages and severe damage to distribution lines and equipment. Taiwan’s Eastern District Office continued emergency repairs and launched cross-regional assistance early on the 1st. (Provided by Taipower) Fax from Central News Agency reporter Lu Taicheng, Taitung, November 1, 113″ srcset=”https://imgcdn.cna.com.tw/www/WebPhotos/800/20241101/1108x1477_wmkn_450133645456_202411010076 .jpg 414w, https://imgcdn.cna.com.tw/www/WebPhotos/1024/20241101/1108x1477_wmkn_450133645456_202411010076 .jpg 1024w”/>The typhoon brought strong winds and heavy rain and hit Taitung, causing many power outages and severe damage to distribution lines and equipment. Taiwan’s Eastern District Office continued emergency repairs and launched cross-regional assistance early on the 1st. (Provided by Taipower) Fax from Central News Agency reporter Lu Taicheng, Taitung, November 1, 113 (Central News Agency reporter Liu Qianling, Taipei) Typhoon Kangri’s storm circle exited Taiwan early today, according to reports. As of 2:00 p.m. today, 803,000 in Taiwan have been repaired. 89,000 households are without power, including Hualien County and Taitung County, about 40,000. T families are still without electricity and power supply in different areas Will make every effort to recover
The Central Meteorological Administration of the Ministry of Transport and Communications lifted the land typhoon warning for Typhoon Kangri at 11:30 am today and the marine warning is expected to be lifted at 2:30 pm.
Taipower reported that as of 2pm today, 893,162 households in Taiwan have experienced power outages, of which 803,366 households have been repaired and 89,796 households have yet to have power restored, including 21,602 households, 11,980 in Taoyuan City, New Taipei City. households, 5,478 households in Chiayi County, 4,110 families in Taichung City, 3,815 families in Yunlin County, 3,271 families in Taipei City, 1,527 families, 1,039 families in Hsinchu County, 703 families in Miaoli County, 662 families in Kaohsiung City, 572 families in Tainan City, 456 families in Changhua County and There are 12 households in Keelung town.
Taipower said that as the wind and rain subsided in some areas, it immediately mobilized its own and contractor manpower to carry out emergency repairs. However, many urban areas were still severely affected by downed trees. After the disaster, many counties and cities resumed work and classes today will, some roads will be affected by traffic congestion, thereby increasing the difficulty of emergency repairs
In the face of the typhoon disaster, Taipower said it is working closely with local governments to make emergency repairs and gradually restore power supply to various areas.
Taipower reminds users that if there is a power outage, please first determine whether the power outage is only for your own household or for all users in the neighborhood, it is recommended to check whether you have your own switch first. If there is any abnormality, Electrical and Mechanical Co. Contact the staff of Ltd. (Editor: Zhang Junmao) 1131101
Chuosha “Issei Shimbun” app
